definition: to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

sentences.english: At least we won’t make that mistake again, right?
sentences.chinese: 至少我们不能一错再错了，对吗？

sentences.english: If money is also a kind of wrong, I will repeat one's mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 如果有钱也是一种错，那我情愿一错再错。

sentences.english: Do not repeat the mistakes again hurt others.
sentences.chinese: 不要一错再错的伤害别人。

sentences.english: In blind error when I did persever.
sentences.chinese: 我却盲目地一错再错入歧途。

sentences.english: Where Does My Love Go Wrong?
Were I wrong to love you, I'd rather be wrong repeatedly.
sentences.chinese: 如果爱你是一种错，我宁愿一错再错。

sentences.english: It is Japan that provoked the issue and made mistakes one after another that led to the escalation.
sentences.chinese: 是日方挑起事端，一错再错，导致事态升级。

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to make a serious mistake (idiom)
to repent
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
deliberate violation (idiom); intentional crime
blunder
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to regret one's past deeds (idiom)
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to make an error
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: irrevocable/the die is cast
